DOCNAME: CASE OF LULIC AND BECKER v. CROATIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses - claim dismissed
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , respectively , and live in GPE , GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants ' house in PERSON was blown up by unknown perpetrators .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants instituted civil proceedings against the ORG in ORG ( PERSON ) seeking damages . They based their claim on LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave judgment dismissing the applicants ' claim on its merits .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants appealed to ORG ( PERSON u GPE ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG introduced an amendment to LAW ( “ the LAW ” ) which provided that all proceedings concerning actions for damages resulting from terrorist acts were to be stayed pending the enactment of new legislation on the subject .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG stayed the proceedings pursuant to LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG introduced the Act on Liability for Damage Resulting from Terrorist Acts and Public Demonstrations ( “ the DATE LAW ” ) .
CARDINAL . It appears that the proceedings resumed on DATE , pursuant to the DATE LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case was transferred to ORG ( PERSON ) as the appellate court , due to changes in jurisdiction .
It appears that the proceedings are still pending .
CARDINAL . The relevant part of LAW ( Zakon o obveznim odnosima , ORG nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) provided as follows :

“ Liability for loss caused by death or bodily injury or by damage or destruction of another 's property , when it results from acts of violence or terror or from public demonstrations or manifestations , lies with the ... authority whose officers were under a duty , according to the laws in force , to prevent such loss . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant part of LAW ( Zakon o izmjeni PERSON o obveznim odnosima , ORG no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) ( “ the DATE LAW ) reads as follows :
“ Section CARDINAL of LAW ( the Official Gazette nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL and DATE ) shall be repealed . ”
“ Proceedings for damages instituted under LAW shall be stayed .
The proceedings referred to in sub - section CARDINAL of this section shall be resumed after the enactment of special legislation governing liability for damage resulting from terrorist acts . ”
This Act entered into force on DATE .
CARDINAL . The relevant part of LAW ( Zakon o parničnom postupku , ORG nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL ) provides :
“ Proceedings shall be stayed :
( CARDINAL ) where another statute so prescribes . ”

CARDINAL . The Act on Liability for Damage Resulting from Terrorist Acts and Public Demonstrations ( Zakon o odgovornosti za štetu nastalu uslijed terorističkih akata i javnih demonstracija , Official Gazette no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) ( “ the DATE LAW ” ) provides , inter alia , that the ORG is to compensate only damage resulting from bodily injuries , impairment of health or death . All compensation for damage to property is to be sought under LAW . LAW provides that all proceedings stayed pursuant to LAW are to be resumed . This Act entered into force on DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP The relevant part of LAW ( Zakon o obnovi , ORG nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) provides , inter alia , that the ORG shall grant , under certain conditions , reconstruction assistance to owners of property ( flats and family houses only ) which has been damaged during the war . The request is to be submitted to the competent ministry .
CARDINAL . The relevant part of CARDINAL of LAW on LAW ( Ustavni zakon o PERSON , ORG no . CARDINAL ) ( “ LAW ” ) reads as follows :

“ ( CARDINAL ) The Constitutional Court shall examine a constitutional complaint whether or not all legal remedies have been exhausted if the court with jurisdiction fails to decide a claim concerning the applicant 's rights and obligations or a criminal charge against him or her within a reasonable time ...

( CARDINAL ) If a constitutional complaint ... under paragraph CARDINAL of this section is upheld , the Constitutional Court shall set a time - limit within which the court with jurisdiction must decide the case on the merits ...

( CARDINAL ) In a decision issued under paragraph CARDINAL of this section , the Constitutional Court shall assess appropriate compensation for the applicant for the violation of his or her constitutional rights ... The compensation shall be paid out of the ORG budget within DATE from the date a request for payment is lodged . ”
CARDINAL . DATE ( Ustav Republike Hrvatske , ORG no . CARDINAL ) reads as follows :

“ In the determination of his rights and obligations or of any criminal charge against him , everyone is entitled to a fair hearing within a reasonable time by an independent and impartial court established by law . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG gave decision no . ORG in the case of PERSON N. , who had filed a constitutional complaint under section CARDINAL of LAW alleging a breach of LAW § CARDINAL of the LAW . He complained about the length of the proceedings and of lack of access to a court because his action in the domestic courts had been stayed by statute for a long period . In its decision , ORG held that there had been a violation of the constitutional rights to a trial within a reasonable time and to access to a court . It ordered the court concerned to give a decision in Mr ORG 's case within DATE , and awarded him compensation .
